summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing a media request from a TV producer for an interview about the Ishi Woney case. The request is declined because the FBI team is focused on the ongoing Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It reveals coordination between FBI public affairs and investigative teams regarding media inquiries.

persons.name: Malcolm Davidson
persons.context: TV producer with Efran Films who sent an external email request to the FBI Public Affairs office seeking an on-camera interview with FBI special agents involved in the Ishi Woney investigation and arrest.

persons.name: Ishi Woney
persons.context: A sex trafficker tied to a missing persons case, who was sentenced in 2019 and is incarcerated at Terre Haute USP. The media request is specifically about interviewing FBI agents involved in his investigation and arrest.

events.title: Ishi Woney sentencing
events.description: Ishi Woney was sentenced in 2019 for sex trafficking and is currently incarcerated at Terre Haute USP.

events.title: Maxwell trial ongoing
events.description: The FBI team is noted to be 'on trial for Maxwell starting today,' indicating the Ghislaine Maxwell trial is actively proceeding, which is why they decline the media interview request.

keyFacts: A TV producer requested an interview with FBI agents involved in the Ishi Woney sex trafficking case, but the FBI team declined due to their involvement in the ongoing Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Ishi Woney is identified as a convicted sex trafficker tied to a missing persons case, sentenced in 2019 and incarcerated at Terre Haute USP.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination between public affairs specialists and investigative teams regarding external media inquiries.
The document references the Ghislaine Maxwell trial as a priority for the FBI team, indicating its active status in late November 2021.
The media request came from Efran Films, which was producing a documentary series on missing people for CBS titled 'Never Seen Again'.
